title: (x) Retro-Futuristic Font / Geometric sans - similar to Chalet London 1980 {Viviane}
content:
All, I'd be grateful if any of you experts on this board could help me ID this typeface, from the front panel of a vintage computer.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100819145122im_/http:/typophile.com/files/decsystem10_4448.jpg)
author: woodhousecreative

comments.content: If the original one doesn't get identified, House Industries' very retro [Chalet London 1980](http://web.archive.org/web/20100819145122/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/chalet/) may come close or be a good place to start.

Thanks Vivicity. You're right â€“ Chalet London 1980 does come very close, although I love the very rigid geometrical structure of the font pictured (the zero is a perfect circle, though, of course, the "10" could be a different typeface altogether). Thanks much.

You're welcome.

For all you know they used a lowercase "o" for the zero even then!
